name: places/ChIJNU9sR7BYwokRtNa25wb6xgw
formattedAddress: 1725 York Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1725 York Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

editorialSummary.text: All-season domed tennis facility featuring hard courts, adult & junior lessons & a pro shop.

originalText.text:
My second time booking a clinic at this institution, because I felt the actual class the first time went decently, and I’m met by rude and hostile employees. I saw a review say, basically, I don’t care about the customer service, I care about how the instructors are. By the time you get into class you’ll have gone through a whirlwind at the desk.
This time, I call, and the person on the phone dismissed me and hung up before I could properly address what I had to. I called back to let the person know that I hadn’t finished and was told to “hurry up and ask then, Maria”, this happens to be my mothers name on my caller ID. He says that he has more calls, it’s after Christmas and they’re busy (apparently there is enough time still for him justifying his actions). When I let him know of his continuous assumptions, that were leaving me stunned, at how crass and arrogantly a customer is treated at their facility, he hung up on me again.

The atmosphere at this institution is hostile, disrespectful, racially charged, and classist. Do not give your business to money hungry institutions that do not appreciate, consider, or value you in their dealings. Honestly left feeling sad about this place, but, that’ll pass, they are not the only tennis facility for your business or mine.

A decent facility that is ultimately devalued by lack of human decency. Happy holidays.

originalText.text: class cancelled last min with no legitimate explanation when i already got there. complete waste of my time. it’s just simply not how you do business.

text.text: class cancelled last min with no legitimate explanation when i already got there. complete waste of my time. it’s just simply not how you do business.

originalText.text: I booked a tennis class through ClassPass for the first time in my life. The court is in a unique and hidden space within a hotel. The coach leading the class was helpful:  There are 5 people in my group with different levels, and although the class was only an hour long, we covered a range of exercises, including front-hand and backhand shots, as well as group competition exercises.

text.text: I booked a tennis class through ClassPass for the first time in my life. The court is in a unique and hidden space within a hotel. The coach leading the class was helpful:  There are 5 people in my group with different levels, and although the class was only an hour long, we covered a range of exercises, including front-hand and backhand shots, as well as group competition exercises.

originalText.text:
As several people have already mentioned, awful customer service, the lady who answered the phone was incredibly rude and disrespectful. I asked her one question and she was very impolite and ill-mannered, rushed through the conversation and hung up the phone abruptly while I was in the middle of a sentence.

I have read several complaints about the same thing, yet the same person is still answering the phone, she does not represent this institution properly. You should not have such impatient and inconsiderate people working customer service, after that phone call I decided to look for other options.

As several people have already mentioned, awful customer service, the lady who answered the phone was incredibly rude and disrespectful. I asked her one question and she was very impolite and ill-mannered, rushed through the conversation and hung up the phone abruptly while I was in the middle of a sentence.

I have read several complaints about the same thing, yet the same person is still answering the phone, she does not represent this institution properly. You should not have such impatient and inconsiderate people working customer service, after that phone call I decided to look for other options.

originalText.text:
I called them and the person on a call was nice and with my background I should be good to do Drill & Play (which is one hr drill and one hr double play) and sold me 10 class package. He did push the deadline to use the package to the end of the year 2022, which was nice.

The first day I went the instructor told me 30 min into my class that I am not good enough for this class (I played high school tennis competitively but have not played regularly for almost 15 yrs) and I should talk to the manager to switch the package to something else. First of all, that made me feel terrible for the rest of the class.

Then, I emailed the manager and she just told me no refund or switch possible. So... Now I am stuck with 9 classes and I do not enjoy it at all. I ended up going to Sutton east tennis and they are a bit nicer to take the Drill & Play and also more spacious but I wish I could change to a cardio class. I would never go back to this place and probably will do cardio class at Sutton east in the future. Very annoyed...

Also, trying to book classes is hard and this location is tiny.
